messages.content: What is the ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation based on?
The ComfyUI-DiffusionLight implementation is based on the DiffusionLight method (https://github.com/DiffusionLight/DiffusionLight) for creating light probes.
Where should the included LoRA be placed for ComfyUI-DiffusionLight to work?
The included LoRA should be placed in the ComfyUI/loras folder, as usual.
Is the included LoRA converted from the original diffusers version?
Yes, the included LoRA is converted from the original diffusers version that won't work in Comfy as it is.
Where can I find example workflows for ComfyUI-DiffusionLight?
Example workflows for ComfyUI-DiffusionLight can be found in the examples folder. The images provided in the document show two examples of generated light probes using the extension.
Can I see examples of light probes created with ComfyUI-DiffusionLight?

Yes, you can see examples of light probes created with ComfyUI-DiffusionLight in the provided images: [image1](https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-DiffusionLight/assets/40791699/8a9ffecf-76b4-4d56-9bbf-b20719cb7ac2), [image2](https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-DiffusionLight/assets/40791699/4f80df84-6c5b-420a-b746-b8890ef1bb31), [image3](https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-DiffusionLight/assets/40791699/ee7b9053-bb31-4324-a946-b4e180003eae).
